conbody.p: A circulating pump is used when a system requires a circulating loop or there is a storage tank used in conjunction with the water heater. The tank is provided with a 3/4" NPT recirculation loop return connection. See for its location. See for installation location of circulating pumps.
See for electrical hookup information. Install in accordance with the current edition of the National Electrical Code, NFPA 70 or the Canadian Electrical Code, CSA C22.1.
Stainless steel circulating pumps are recommended for use with commercial water heaters.
